meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a deaf person.
meanings.sent1: The quiet room had a deafish atmosphere, with everyone communicating through gestures.
meanings.sent2: The deafish expression on her face made it clear she couldn't hear the music.
meanings.sent3: The deafish cat ignored all attempts to call it for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The deafish silence in the library was broken only by the occasional turning of pages.
meanings.sent5: The deafish stillness of the night was only interrupted by the distant hoot of an owl.

meanings.sent1: The deafish puppy didn't respond to his name being called.
meanings.sent2: She spoke louder to the deafish old man, hoping he would hear her.
meanings.sent3: The deafish phone refused to ring, leaving her unaware of the incoming call.
meanings.sent4: The deafish doorbell failed to alert them of the visitor's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The deafish look in his eyes hinted at his struggle to hear clearly.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of being deaf.
meanings.sent1: The deafish student relied on lip-reading to understand the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The deafish child communicated through sign language with ease.
meanings.sent3: The deafish alarm clock failed to wake him up in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The deafish expression on her face showed her difficulty in hearing.
meanings.sent5: The deafish silence in the room made it hard to follow the conversation.
